clinical_study.brief_title: Increasing Activity in Liver Transplant Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Increasing Physical Activity in Post Liver Transplant Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Will adult liver transplant patients who are provided with physical activity (walking) instructions increase their physical activity and perceive an improved quality of life?

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who increase their physical activity

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients who have improved quality of life

other_outcome.measure: Number of patients who document their physical activity

arm_group.description: Participants will be provided physical activity walking instructions and asked to record their daily activity on an activity log.

intervention.description: Participants will be provided physical activity walking instructions and asked to record their daily activity on an activity log. Participants will be given the International Physical Activity Questionnaire and asked about their quality of life at baseline, at 6 weeks and at 4 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Adult patients 18-65 years of age who receive a liver transplant at Mayo Clinic Jacksonville.
- Adult patients who are 5-21 days post liver transplant.
- Must be followed by Mayo Clinic Jacksonville at 4 months postoperatively.
- Approved by a hepatologist and/or transplant surgeon to participate.
Exclusion criteria:
- Patients with active infections
- Patients with encephalopathy or cognitive dysfunction
- Patients who receive a combined liver-kidney transplant
- Patients with severe debility
- Patients who require assistance to ambulate.
